author: T K
text:
In a potential blow to the Tamil Nadu Arasu Cable TV Corporation Ltd, nearly 15,000 cable operators have begun signing up with the Tamizhaga Cable TV Communications Pvt Ltd (TCCL), a multi-system operator (MSO), run by cable TV operators.

On Tuesday, at the annual general body meeting of the Tamizhaga Cable TV Operators Association chaired by its founder P. Sakilan, operators from various parts of the State signed up with TCCL.

The trigger seems to be the delay in Arasu Cable getting the Digital Addressable System (DAS) licence .

“The government had said the last-mile operators will be protected and taken care of, but even in case of a death, no compensation is given to families of cable operators,” G. Dhamodaran, secretary, TCOA told The Hindu .

“The government promised quality service when Arasu Cable was launched. But, nearly 42 lakh subscribers have switched over to DTH. Why would they even though it is expensive than Arasu Cable,” he asked.

Meanwhile, RailTel Corporation, is tying up with cable operators in the State to roll out broadband services.

Delay in Arasu Cable getting Digital Addressable System licence a reason
title: Cable operators start moving to TCCL
